text:
Bottle (jar) 180ml. @ [ (Chris and Ruths pre-GBBF tasting 2015) by chriso - London ]. [ As Hakurei Junmai Hakurei Sake ].Clear cristal water colored with no head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, coconut. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration, rice, coconut, alcohol, fruity notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20150808]
 7-1-7-3-14

Bottle (jar) shared at the 2015 chriso Pre-GBBF tasting - London. Cheers! Pours clear. The nose has light frosting, white rice. Medium sweet flavour, lightly creamy, with notes of white sugar and faint fruity notes. Medium bodied, oily. Warming on the finish, a touch watery, with some alcohol and pear. Fine.

Bottle share at Chrisos. Clear, no colour, no head. Aroma is sweet, sugar syrup. Body is medium, soft carbonation, smooth. Taste is boozey, gin, flowers, some tart fruits. Not bad. Better than sakes Ive had previously. Dry and gin-like.

Aroma and taste is of rice, grain, some fruity notes, overt boozy.
Bottle at Chris & Ruths pre-GBBF shindig, 2015. Yellow gold pour. Sweet syrupy fruit aroma and flavour. Not my bag this one.

Bottle at ChrisOs Pre - GBBF tasting 2015. It pours clear as one might expect. The nose is toasted grain, umami, rice pudding and cereal. The taste is bitter, boozy, rice paper, pear, peach, passion fruit and some creaminess with a dry finish. Medium body and slick, hot mouth - feel. A bit rough around the edges of truth be told. OK anyhow.
Funny Bottle at Chris & Ruths pre GBBF shindig; clear white pour, aroma has done sweetness, taste has quite big alcohol presence some sweetness, hint of fruit.
Bottle at pre GBBF 2015. Clear ish no head. Quite a dry rice character. Not too much fruit. OK if a little simple.
Bottle at Chris and Ruths pre-GBBF tasting 2015. No color. Rise and potato aroma, maybe some fruits. Fruity rise flavor, a bit one dimensional.
18 cl bottle. Pours pale, no head. Aroma is mild fruity, crisp rise. Sweet, rice fruity. Smooth toasted rice and fruity into the finish.

180 ml cup from Isetan. Rather boring nose of rice, grains. Clear, slightly oily. Sweet, rice, cream, light peaches or melon. Very simple. One-dimensional, sweet, fruity. Not bad, but not worth mentioning either.
